intro: Sphaerostephanos microlonchus, commonly known as the small-lancehead sphaerostephanus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
